snippet: The brother of Gao Zhisheng, a prominent dissident rights lawyer who had been missing for 20 months, said Sunday that he was being held in a prison in Xinjiang.
abstract: Gao Zhiyi reports that his family has received official word that his brother Gao Zhisheng, prominent Chinese dissident rights lawyer who has been missing for 20 months, is being held in a remote prison where he has to serve three more years.
lead_paragraph: The brother of Gao Zhisheng, a prominent dissident rights lawyer who had been missing for 20 months, said Sunday that he was being held in a prison in Xinjiang.

headline.seo: Missing Dissident Chinese Lawyer Said to Be in Remote Prison
headline.main: Missing Chinese Lawyer Said to Be in Remote Prison
headline.print_headline: Missing Chinese Lawyer Said to Be in Remote Prison
